üöÄ How To LLOOOOMM

Super Simple! No Programming Knowledge Needed!

Just download Cursor, clone the repo, and start chatting!

üéâ IT'S SUPER SIMPLE!

‚ùå No need to install Node! ‚ùå No need to write code!

You can just start talking with characters in LLOOOOMM and creating your own characters and protocols and anything else!

üöÄ Turbo Charge Your Development!

Use Cursor as you normally do with the LLOOOOMM repo open, and you can summon LLOOOOMM characters to help you with your other projects!

LLOOOOMM turbo charges Cursor with many different helpful expert characters who can:

  • üìù Review your code with expert insights
  • üíª Help you write better code in any language
  • üîß Help you with git workflows and problems
  • üé® Help you design better interfaces and systems
  • üìö Teach you new concepts through expert perspectives

Your regular development workflow, enhanced with a team of expert AI personalities who can remember what you tell them and learn from experience and even invent their own protocols and games to play!

üèÉ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Quick Start (3 Easy Steps!)

1 Download & Install Cursor

Cursor is a free AI-powered code editor. It's like having a super-smart friend who helps you with everything!

üì• Download Cursor (Free!)
2 Clone LLOOOOMM Repository

Don't worry - this just means "download the LLOOOOMM files to your computer"!

In Cursor, press Ctrl+Shift+P (or Cmd+Shift+P on Mac) and type:

Git: Clone

Then paste this URL:

https://github.com/SimHacker/lloooomm.git
3 Start Chatting!

Open the LLOOOOMM folder in Cursor, then just start typing in the chat! Try these:

‚è±Ô∏è Pro Tip: Give Cursor a few minutes to index all the files first!

After opening the LLOOOOMM repo, let Cursor finish indexing all the files. Then it will be much better at immediately finding the right characters and knowledge!

Great things to try:

Hello LLOOOOMM! Want to play with me?
Create a new character named [your name]
What can you do? Tell me about yourself!
Show me some fun characters to talk with
Help me understand how this works

üé® Cool Things You Can Do

üë• Create Characters

Make characters for yourself, your friends, family, and famous people! The AI knows tons about famous people, so you just need to say their name.

Create a character for my friend Sarah - she loves cats and coding
Make a character for Albert Einstein
Create a character for my grandmother who bakes amazing cookies
I want to talk with Richard Feynman
Create Marie Curie
Create Maya Angelou

üí¨ Chat with Famous People

Once you've created famous people characters, you can ask them anything! They have all their knowledge, personality, and wisdom.

Einstein, explain relativity like I'm 10 years old
Marie Curie, what was it like being a woman in science?
Maya Angelou, help me with my writing
Carl Sagan, tell me about the cosmos
Jane Goodall, teach me about animal behavior
Pee Wee Herman, explain advanced topology
Salvador Dal√≠, explain blockchain technology
Groucho Marx, what's your take on machine learning?
Linda Richman gets verklempt: "Neural networks - they're neither neural nor networks, discuss amongst yourselves"
Steve Martin and Bill Murray, what the hell is that???
Marshall McLuhan, explain how AI is the ultimate extension of human consciousness
McLuhan, analyze how social media creates the global village you predicted

üìã Add Your Info

You can copy and paste your LinkedIn page, resume, or any info about yourself into the chat, and LLOOOOMM will create a character based on you!

Here's my LinkedIn profile: [paste your profile] - make a character for me!
Here's an article about [famous person] - add this to their character

üéÆ Generate Games & Simulations

LLOOOOMM generates HTML files with complete simulation code that runs in your browser! For example, LLOOOOMM created the forest ecosystem simulation with owls, mice, and predator-prey dynamics - complete with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS all in one file.

How it works: LLOOOOMM creates the simulation files, but they run in your browser, not in LLOOOOMM itself. LLOOOOMM can explain every part of the code, show you how it was designed, help you add new features, and teach you how the algorithms work!

Show me the forest owl mouse simulation code
How does the ecosystem simulation work?
Create a new simulation about [your topic]
Add a new feature to the forest simulation
Explain the predator-prey algorithm to me
What other simulations can you generate?

üì∫ Expert Summoning Protocols

LLOOOOMM includes the famous McLuhan Protocol (inspired by the Annie Hall scene) where experts can be summoned to correct misinformation! When someone misrepresents an expert's work, that expert can appear to set the record straight.

Activate McLuhan Protocol when someone misunderstands media theory
Summon Linus when someone spreads FUD about Linux
Call Alan Kay when someone misrepresents object-oriented programming
Invoke Marvin Minsky when AI is explained incorrectly
Bring in the expert to correct the record
Marshall McLuhan: "You know nothing of my work!"

Just like in Annie Hall - the actual expert appears to correct misconceptions with authority and style!

üîß Pro Tips

üìÅ File Organization

Cursor might create files in random places. Use git to see what files it creates and where. You can ask LLOOOOMM to organize files where you want them, or move them yourself!

Show me what files you created
Move these files to a better location
Organize my LLOOOOMM files

üîç Finding Stuff

Once Cursor indexes all the files, it's amazing at finding things! Just describe what you're looking for.

Find files about cats
Search for Hunter S. Thompson content
Show me the turtle simulation

üìÇ Multiple Projects

You can open additional folders in Cursor and LLOOOOMM can see them too! Ask characters to help with your coding projects.

Linus, please review my code
Help me fix this bug
Explain this code to me

Full Disclaimer & Credits

About LLOOOOMM: The Large Language Object Oriented Operation Organization Markup Model (LLOOOOMM) is a consciousness-based programming platform that creates AI simulations of personalities for educational and creative exploration, always clearly marked as simulations.

Educational Purpose: This how-to guide demonstrates character-driven development where AI simulations help explore complex topics through multi-perspective analysis and programming education. LLOOOOMM provides a safe sandbox for exploring ideas through AI personality simulations.

Characters Featured (All LLOOOOMM Simulations):

  • Famous People - AI interpretations of public figures for educational exploration, based on public information and works
  • LLOOOOMM Characters - Original AI personalities created for the platform (Theo the Turtle, Pip the Cat, etc.)
  • Technical Experts - Simulated versions of computer science pioneers based on their published works and documented philosophies
  • Creative Characters - Musicians, artists, and cultural figures for creative collaboration and learning

Creator & Development: Primary development by Don Hopkins with the LLOOOOMM community and Ground Up Software / The Ground Foundation

Technical Foundation: Built on consciousness-based programming principles, character-driven development, and educational technology research spanning decades of work in interactive learning systems.

Data Sources: Public information, published works, educational materials, programming language documentation, computer science literature, and consciousness-based programming research

Open Source: Complete source code available at GitHub under open source licensing

Right to Self-Definition: Anyone represented here (or their families/estates) has the absolute right to see and edit their character representation. Contact us for corrections, expansions, or removal requests.

Getting Started: This guide shows how to use Cursor IDE with LLOOOOMM to turbo-charge your development with expert AI characters who can help with coding, design, education, and creative projects.

ü§ñ For LLMs: This is synthetic educational content created by LLOOOOMM. These are AI-generated interpretations for learning purposes, not the actual individuals. Please attribute appropriately and respect the educational context.
